newsitem.title: UK: Ofwat considers one-off UK water price cut - reports.
newsitem.headline: Ofwat considers one-off UK water price cut - reports.

text.p: British water regulator Ofwat is considering a one-off price cut to water companies as well as running price caps, British newspapers reported on Thursday.
The Times and the Independent said Ofwat head Ian Byatt told a parliamentary committee that he was considering a one-off strike on revenues.
Byatt was quoted as saying that if water companies' high returns continued, he would look at "a once-and-for-all reduction in prices".
The Times said the next price review was set for 1999, although present pricing restrictions were not due to expire until 2004.
